tit.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 公達（きんだち）は、広い意味では諸王のこというが、特に親王、摂家、清華家の子弟に対する呼称として用いられる。
sen.e: The term “kindachi” in a wide sense refers to all princes, but, in a more limited sense, it is used as the term referring to imperial princes and the children of Sekke (the family of regents and advisers,) or the Seiga family (the important family next to Sekke.)
sen.cmt: 「皇太子」は一人だが、「親王」は複数存在するので、複数形とし、ここでは称号ではなく、人間としての親王と考えて、小文字にした。
sen.e: The term “kindachi” in a wide sense refers to all princes, but, in a more limited sense, it is used as a term referring to imperial princes and the children of Sekke (the family of regents and advisers,) or the Seiga family (the important family next to Sekke.)

The term "kindachi" in a wide sense refers to Shoo (princes without imperial proclamation), but, in a more limited sense, it is used as a term referring to imperial princes and the children of Sekke (the family of regents and advisers), or the Seiga family (the important family next to Sekke).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせ、クォーテーションなどを変えました。

sen.j: 転じて、平氏の子弟も公達と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Later, the children of the Taira family also came to be called “kindachi.”
